https://gothamist.com/news/nypd-does-not.title: The NYPD doesn’t report where it deploys police. So scientists used AI, dashcams to find out.
https://gothamist.com/news/nypd-does-not.description: Cornell Tech researchers used nearly 25 million rideshare dashcam images to identify police cars on city streets and areas that receive more attention than others.
https://gothamist.com/news/nypd-does-not.author: Neil Mehta

https://news.cornell.edu/stories/2023/07.title: Dashcam images reveal where police are deployed | Cornell Chronicle
https://news.cornell.edu/stories/2023/07.description: Using a deep learning computer model and dashcam images from New York City rideshare drivers, Cornell Tech researchers were able to see which neighborhoods had the highest numbers of New York Police Department marked vehicles.
https://news.cornell.edu/stories/2023/07.author: Tom Fleischman, Cornell Chronicle

https://www.economist.com/science-and-te.title: New York City is covered in illegal scaffolding
https://www.economist.com/science-and-te.description: Machine learning algorithms could help bring it down
https://www.economist.com/science-and-te.author: The Economist

https://news.cornell.edu/stories/2023/08.title: ‘Trashbots’ help Brooklynites clean up, connect | Cornell Chronicle
https://news.cornell.edu/stories/2023/08.description: Cornell Tech researchers deployed “trashbots” in Brooklyn for two weeks in July. The goal of the experiment was to see how people interact with, and make sense of, service robots in public spaces. The cleaning was an added bonus.
https://news.cornell.edu/stories/2023/08.author: Tom Fleischman, Cornell Chronicle

https://techxplore.com/news/2024-06-virt.title: Virtual and mixed realities converge in new driving simulator
https://techxplore.com/news/2024-06-virt.description: Portobello, a new driving simulator developed by researchers at Cornell Tech, blends virtual and mixed realities, enabling both drivers and passengers to see virtual objects overlaid in the real world.
https://techxplore.com/news/2024-06-virt.author: Sarah Marquart

https://futurism.com/the-byte/trash-robo.title: Scientists Find That Only a Few New Yorkers Were Rude to Trash Robots
https://futurism.com/the-byte/trash-robo.description: New Yorkers aren’t exactly known for being nice, which was why it was so shocking that only a few were rude to some trash robots in Greenwich Village.
https://futurism.com/the-byte/trash-robo.author: Noor Al-Sibai

https://news.cornell.edu/stories/2025/04.title: ‘Robotability score’ ranks NYC streets for future robot deployment | Cornell Chronicle
https://news.cornell.edu/stories/2025/04.description: The rating system is the first of its kind and may help urban planners and robotics companies plan for future robot deployments that won’t disrupt existing sidewalk environments.
https://news.cornell.edu/stories/2025/04.author: Patricia Waldron

https://tech.cornell.edu/news/cornell-te.title: Cornell Tech Excels at CHI 2025 with 16 Papers and Faculty Honor
https://tech.cornell.edu/news/cornell-te.description: Sixteen papers from Cornell Tech were honored or featured at the 2025 ACM CHI Conference on Human Factors in Computing Systems.
